glsa.title: FUSE: mtab corruption through fusermount
glsa.synopsis: The fusermount utility from FUSE can be abused to corrupt the /etc/mtab file contents, potentially allowing a local attacker to set unauthorized mount options.

background.p: FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace) allows implementation of a fully functional filesystem in a userspace program. The fusermount utility is used to mount/unmount FUSE file systems.

description.p: Thomas Biege discovered that fusermount fails to securely handle special characters specified in mount points.

impact.p: A local attacker could corrupt the contents of the /etc/mtab file by mounting over a maliciously-named directory using fusermount, potentially allowing the attacker to set unauthorized mount options. This is possible only if fusermount is installed setuid root, which is the default in Gentoo.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
